title: Phase 0: Foundation
description: Project setup, database schema, hosting infrastructure

title: Choose and configure hosting
description: Evaluate and set up hosting: Vercel/Railway/Fly.io/Render. Need: web app, API, Postgres, job queue for crawlers. Consider cost at scale. Acceptance: staging environment deployed, database provisioned, env vars managed securely.

title: Import npm-high-impact package list
description: Seed database with ~15,000 high-impact packages from npm-high-impact. Write import script, mark all as pending enrichment. Script must be idempotent.

title: npm Registry enrichment crawler
description: For each package, fetch from registry.npmjs.org: latest version + publish date, all versions with dates, maintainers list, funding field, repository URL, weekly downloads. Handle rate limiting, update existing records, run incrementally on stale records.

title: OpenCollective enrichment crawler
description: Check if OpenCollective collective exists for each package. Fetch via API: balance, yearlyIncome, backersCount. Handle 404s gracefully, refresh weekly for known collectives.

title: GitHub enrichment crawler
description: For packages with GitHub repos, fetch: FUNDING.yml contents, contributor list + commit counts, last commit date, open issues count, stars/forks, archived status. Parse FUNDING.yml for all platform links, identify primary contributor.

title: Build maintainer identity graph
description: Deduplicate maintainers across packages: npm username -> GitHub username mapping, group packages by maintainer, calculate total downloads per maintainer, link to GitHub Sponsors. Example: lukeed -> clsx, uvu, klona, etc.

title: Create corporate backing database
description: Manually curate list of corporate-backed packages as JSON: react/react-dom -> Meta, typescript -> Microsoft, angular -> Google, next/turbo -> Vercel, etc. Import script to database. Prevents these from getting needs-support score.

title: Create AI disruption flag database
description: Manually curate packages affected by AI disruption (e.g., tailwindcss). Include: package name, disruption type, notes, source. Surfaces in UI with special badge.

title: Build sustainability scoring algorithm
description: Implement Robin Hood scoring. Inputs: weekly_downloads, dependent_count, oc_balance, oc_yearly_income, github_sponsors, corporate_backing, maintainer_count, days_since_publish, ai_disruption_flag. Output: score 0-100, category (critical/needs-support/stable/thriving/corporate), explanation. Weights configurable, unit tested.

title: Build dependency input UI
description: Create main landing page: paste textarea for dependencies/devDependencies JSON, parse and validate client-side, extract package names and versions, show count of detected packages. Handle malformed input gracefully. Strict sanitization - expect prompt injection attempts.

title: Phase 1: Data Collection Layer
description: Package index seeding, crawlers for npm/OpenCollective/GitHub, maintainer identity graph, curated data, scoring algorithm

title: Build donation allocation UI
description: Display results after analysis: budget input, allocation breakdown by package, grouped by category (critical/needs-support/stable/corporate), each row shows package/score/amount/donate links. Maintainer grouping to collapse packages by same person. Copy as text/markdown buttons. Mobile responsive.

title: Handle unknown packages gracefully
description: When dependencies contain packages not in our index: show as Unknown category, queue for async enrichment, show auto-generated OC link as fallback, update UI when enrichment completes or on refresh.

title: Build package detail drawer
description: Clicking a package shows detailed view: full sustainability breakdown, all funding sources with platform icons, maintainer info with their other packages, version info, last activity signals, links to npm/GitHub/OpenCollective. Slide-out drawer or modal.

title: Create package lookup API
description: GET /api/packages/:name returns full sustainability data. POST /api/packages/batch accepts array of package names, returns array of data. Handle missing packages gracefully, trigger enrichment for unknowns. Rate limiting in place.

title: Create analysis API
description: POST /api/analyze accepts dependencies JSON, returns parsed deps, sustainability data, suggested allocation based on budget param. Calls batch lookup internally. Optionally stores anonymous usage snapshot with consent flag.

title: Create usage aggregation pipeline
description: When users submit dependencies with consent: increment usage count per package, track version distribution, build co-dependency graph (packages commonly used together). Never store identifiable data. Enable queries like 'packages commonly used with X' and 'version distribution for X'.

title: Implement GitHub OAuth authentication
description: Allow users to sign in with GitHub OAuth. Create user record on first login, store GitHub username. Use NextAuth.js or Lucia. Session persists across visits, sign out works.

title: Build saved projects feature
description: Logged-in users can save their dependencies: name the project, store the dependency list, track over time as deps change. CRUD operations: save, list, re-analyze, delete.

title: Build donation logging
description: Users can log donations: select package from tracked deps, enter amount/date/platform, see donation history, running total. Filter by date range.

title: Build OSS debt dashboard
description: Show users their debt status: total suggested allocation across all projects minus donations made = current debt balance. Visual progress toward suggested amount. Notification thresholds ($5, $10, $25). Email notifications when threshold hit.

title: Phase 2: Web Application
description: Public package analyzer, donation allocation UI, API layer

title: Implement package claim flow
description: Maintainers can claim their packages: search for package, prove ownership via GitHub repo collaborator status. Mark package as verified maintainer with badge.

title: Build maintainer profile page
description: Claimed packages link to maintainer profile at /maintainer/:username. Shows: bio, links, all claimed packages with sustainability data, total ecosystem impact (downloads), funding links, recent updates. Editable by owner.

title: Build funding status editor
description: Verified maintainers can update packages: add/edit funding URLs, set status (thriving/stable/needs-support/critical), add maintainer note explaining situation, toggle AI disruption flag. Changes reflect immediately in public data.

title: Build usage analytics for maintainers
description: Show maintainers anonymized usage data for claimed packages: total projects using package, version distribution chart, common co-dependencies, trend over time. Aggregate-only, no PII.

title: Build donor thank-you feature
description: Maintainers can respond to donations: see donation activity summary (anonymous: '3 people donated this month'), post public thank-you message visible in donor dashboards.

title: Implement caching layer
description: Add Redis or similar for: package data (TTL: 1 hour), batch query results, rate limiting counters. Target >80% cache hit rate, cache invalidation on updates, fallback to DB on miss.

title: Optimize batch package lookup
description: For large dependency lists (100+ packages): parallel fetching with concurrency limit, return partial results as available, background enrich missing packages. Target: 100-package analysis < 3 seconds, progressive UI loading, no timeouts.

title: Build admin review queue
description: Admin interface to: review flagged packages, manually set corporate backing, verify AI disruption claims, merge duplicate maintainer records. Admin-only route, queue of items needing review, approve/reject/edit actions, audit log.

title: Implement community suggestions
description: Let users suggest corrections: 'This package is corporate-backed by X', 'This maintainer funding link is Y', 'This package is AI-disrupted because Z'. Suggestions go to review queue, admin can approve to update data, suggester notified of outcome.

title: Build browser extension
description: Chrome/Firefox extension: detects package.json in GitHub file view, shows sustainability badge overlay, quick link to full analysis on support-oss.dev.

title: Phase 3: User Authentication
description: GitHub OAuth login foundation for user features

title: Build CLI tool
description: npx support-oss analyze: reads local package.json or dependencies from stdin, outputs sustainability report to terminal, optionally opens web UI with results. --json flag for CI integration.

title: Create public API for third parties
description: Documented API: GET /api/v1/package/:name, POST /api/v1/analyze (batch). API key management, rate limiting per key, OpenAPI/Swagger docs, example integrations.

title: Add algorithm tuning UI - let users customize donation allocation with checkboxes (e.g., boost recently updated packages, reward active maintenance, adjust weighting by downloads)
description:
Allow users to tweak the donation allocation algorithm via UI controls:

- Checkbox: Boost packages with recent releases (reward active maintenance)
- Checkbox: Weight by download count (more downloads = more allocation)
- Checkbox: Penalize packages with corporate backing
- Checkbox: Prioritize single-maintainer projects
- Slider: Adjust how aggressively to favor 'critical' packages

This gives users agency over how their donations are distributed while still providing sensible defaults.

title: Phase 4: Maintainer Features
description: Package claiming, maintainer profiles, funding status editor, usage analytics

title: Phase 5: Scale & Polish
description: Caching, performance optimization, admin tools, browser extension, CLI, public API

title: Initialize monorepo structure
description: Set up pnpm workspaces or turborepo with packages: web (Next.js), api, db (schema + migrations), crawler (workers), shared (types). Basic CI/CD with GitHub Actions, ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript configs. Acceptance: monorepo runs locally with single command, all packages have TS configured, CI runs lint + type-check on PRs.

title: Set up core database schema
description: Design and implement core data model: Packages table (npm packages with sustainability data), Maintainers table, FundingSources table, PackageMaintainers join table. Tech: Postgres + Drizzle ORM. Acceptance: schema defined, migrations work locally and CI, seed script with test data.

title: Set up user-facing database schema
description: Add user-facing tables: Users table (developers using platform), UsageSnapshots (anonymous aggregated usage), Donations table (tracked donation history). Depends on core schema.

title: Phase 3.5: User Tracking & Dashboard
description: Saved projects, donation logging, OSS debt dashboard for users to track their open source contributions
